alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:26PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Weld, northwestern Arapahoe, northern Denver and western Adams Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brighton to 4 miles southeast of Federal Heights, or along a line extending from 28 miles south of Greeley to 5 miles north of Denver. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Denver, Aurora, Thornton, eastern Westminster, Commerce City, Northglenn, Brighton, Federal Heights, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Lochbuie, Buckley SFB, Barr Lake and Todd Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.
